This place is a hidden gem.  I haven't been to many coffees shops in Barcelona, as I was only there for a week and upon Yelping what places to go to brunch in the area, this was one of the first that popped up.  It is filled with locals and not a tourist trap.  A boho/ hipster theme, it was a perfect way to enjoy a cappuccino and some casual tapas for brunch.  I started off with some warm muesli, then we had some hummus with spiced chips, followed by some cheese and almond tapas.  We then went ahead and ordered a cheesecake and delicious orange wine cake for dessert.  Definitely take the time to come here, it is not overly packed, it is quiet, and just a quaint and pleasant atmosphere!
